metadata.title: CVE-2018-0502 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in zsh before 5.6. The beginning of a #! scriptfile was mishandled, potentially leading to an execve call to a programnamed on the second line.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-0502` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

zsh - 5.1.1-1ubuntu2.3
zsh-common - 5.1.1-1ubuntu2.3
zsh-static - 5.1.1-1ubuntu2.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zsh package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.1.1-1ubuntu2.3').
